subject: Re: Naming Test classes, was:Re: [junit] Test Variants
msgSnippet: Unfortunately there is no well know naming convention... But you could write: testAccountTransferWithTheSameAccountUsingJTAInterfaceAndJTSCompliantTransa
messageBody:
Unfortunately there is no well know naming convention...
But you could write:
"testAccountTransferWithTheSameAccountUsingJTAInterfaceAndJTSCompliantTransa
ctionManager()" as name of test case method &-) why not??? . I think there
is no reason to duplicate word "Test" in the name of test case -- it is the
same as duplication of word "Class" in class name :)

Usually test cases are concerned with BOUNDARY SISTUATION, want you or not
but THIS BOUNDARY SITUATION should be described, let the name of test case
describe this situation well. Test cases should be supported, they are
changed during time some. User of your test suite should understand you test
case freely...

JMHO

----- Original Message -----
From: "Johannes Link" <john.link@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Friday, July 05, 2002 10:06 AM
Subject: Re: Naming Test classes, was:Re: [junit] Test Variants


> > Simply choose descriptive names. Why wouldn't that be enough to find
> > the tests? If you had to name the test RIGHT NOW, what would you name
> > it? Perhaps that name is good enough.
>
> Would your suggestion for the test class which has two accounts in its
> fixture then be "AccountTestWithTwoAccounts" rather than
"AccountTranferTest"?
> What about the one transfer test which needs only one account? Where does
it go?
>
> Johannes
